assessment_steps.step_name: Step 2: Evaluate applicability of general classes of assay used in the field
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: Our recent single-molecule FRET (smFRET) study shed new light on the folding characteristics of wild-type (WT; 140 residues) a-synuclein as induced by binding to small unilamellar vesicles (SUVs), and membrane and lipid mimetics.
assessment_steps.reasoning: The smFRET assay used in the paper is relevant to understanding protein folding and interactions, which are important mechanisms in the context of PD pathogenesis.

assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: That study in combination with previous ensemble thermodynamics measurements clearly established that the bent and helical a-synuclein structures could coexist in the presence of the same binding partners.
